intro: Canarium nervosum, commonly known as the white nutmeg tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and lanceolate,革质 (leathery) leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by woody, three-lobed fruits containing aromatic seeds. The seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to nutmeg. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests.
